channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Apple Music pays a penny per stream, double Spotify's rate
item.description: But Spotify users typically stream more songs, leading to higher payouts overall.

item.title: This week's best deals: $20 off Google's Nest Audio and more
item.description: Here are this week's best tech deals, including $20 off Google's Nest Audio smart speaker and more than $50 off Apple's AirPods Pro.

item.title: Fitbit is reportedly working on a 'luxury' fitness tracker
item.description: A leak may have revealed the Fitbit Luxe, an upscale fitness tracker for those who want fashion without a smartwatch.

item.title: ASUS Zephyrus G15 review (2021): All the gaming laptop you need
item.description: The ASUS Zephyrus G15 has almost everything we'd want in a gaming laptop.

item.title: Livestorm is the Zoom alternative you didn’t know you needed
item.description: It turns out, video conferencing can actually be enjoyable

item.title: Apple says selling new iPhones without power adapters will save 861,000 tons of metal
item.description: The company highlighted carbon capture and energy efficiency in its 2021 Environmental Progress Report.

item.title: We're still spending record amounts on gaming, a year into the pandemic
item.description: Video game sales hit another record in March 2021 thanks to the PS5, Switch and a handful of hit games.

item.title: Sound location inspired by bat ears could help robots navigate outdoors
item.description: Researchers have developed bat-inspired, AI-guided sound location that could help robots navigate outside.

item.title: Square Enix denies takeover rumors
item.description: Square Enix has denied reports that it is being targeted by multiple buyers for a potential takeover.

item.title: Tesla settles with ex-employee over Autopilot code theft accusations
item.description: Tesla has settled with a former employee that it sued for downloading data related to its Autopilot feature.

item.title: San Francisco's Clipper transit card gets iPhone and Apple Watch support
item.description: The Metropolitan Transportation Commission has launched support for Clipper, Bay Area's all-in-one reloadable transit card, on the iPhone and the Apple Watch.

item.title: The best smart speakers you can buy
item.description: Here's a list of the best smart speakers you can buy -- for every budget -- plus tips and tricks on how to choose the right one for you.

item.title: Engadget Podcast: NVIDIA bets big on ARM, Surface Laptop 4 arrives
item.description: This week, Cherlynn and Devindra chat about NVIDIA’s massive GTC developer conference. It turns out ARM chips are going to be a much bigger deal for NVIDIA! Also, they discuss the recently announced Surface Laptop 4 and Microsoft’s new family of accessories.

item.title: SpaceX gets the go-ahead for Crew Dragon launch to ISS next week
item.description: NASA and SpaceX's Crew Dragon is a go for liftoff to the International Space Station next week following the completion of a Flight Readiness Review.

item.title: The Morning After: Touring Mercedes' very luxurious EV
item.description: Today’s other headlines: Ferrari's CEO promises an EV in 2025, Amazon finally adds book covers to your Kindle lock screens and the US expels Russian diplomats in response to SolarWinds hack.

item.title: Walmart invests in GM-owned autonomous car startup Cruise
item.description: Walmart has invested in GM's self-driving car subsidiary Cruise following their partnership on a pilot delivery program.

item.title: Google found to have 'partially' misled Australian users in location tracking case
item.description: The Australian Federal Court has ruled that Google "partially" misled users in the country when it comes to how it collects and uses location data.

item.title: Google's Project Zero will wait longer before disclosing security flaws
item.description: Google's Project Zero security team will wait an extra 30 days before disclosing vulnerability details so end-users have enough time to patch software.

item.title: Ferrari's CEO promises an EV in 2025
item.description: Ferrari's acting CEO says the sports car company has an "electrification strategy" that includes unveiling its first EV in 2025.

item.title: Google makes it easy to jump back to the search box by pressing '/'
item.description: Google has rolled out a new Search shortcut that can quickly help you refine the results you get.

item.title: 'Resident Evil Village' demo is coming soon, but sooner on PS4 and PS5
item.description: PlayStation owners will get first crack at the 'Resident Evil Village' demos starting this weekend.

item.title: Netflix's 'Resident Evil' series premieres in July
item.description: 'Resident Evil: Infinite Darkness' is coming to Netflix in July.

item.title: NFL adds DraftKings and Fanduel as official betting partners
item.description: On Thursday, the NFL announced a multi-year deal with Ceasars Entertainment, DraftKings and FanDuel that will see those three companies become official betting partners of the league.

item.title: Some Kindle ereaders can now display your current book as your lockscreen
item.description: File this one under a feature the Kindle probably should have had since launch.

item.title: Disney's latest MCU series accounted for 495 million minutes of streaming in one week
item.description: It should come as no surprise, but The Falcon and the Winter Soldier is a massive success for Disney+.
